intro: Apoterium, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araliaceae. It consists of several species, predominantly native to the eastern United States. The plants are characterized by their dark green, leathery leaves and clusters of small, white or greenish flowers. Apoterium typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and relatively rare plant in the wild.
